Pataka.usage: Clouds, forest, stopping, blessings, denial, river, opening a door.

Tripataka.usage: Crown, tree, an arrow, flames, thunder, pigeon, lamp.

Ardhapataka.usage: Leaves, a board, knife, tower, bank of river.

Kartari Mukha.usage: Separation, opposition, corner of the eye, lightning.

Mayura.usage: Peacock, bird, creeper, vomiting, putting tilak, something delicate.

Ardha-Chandra.usage: Half moon, offering, hand-seal, waist, greeting.

Shukatunda.usage: Parrot's head, shooting an arrow, a spear, mystery.

Mushti.usage: Steadiness, grasping hair, holding objects, strength.

Kapitta.usage: Lakshmi, Saraswati, milking cows, holding cymbals.

Katakamukha.usage: Wearing a necklace, garland, plucking flowers, holding curtain.

Suchi.usage: One, the world, pointing, threatening, talking about a person.

Padmakosha.usage: Fruit, flower, ball, breast, fullness, offering.

Sarpashirsha.usage: Snake hood, sandal paste, applying scent, blessing.

Mrigashirsha.usage: Deer head, massage, cheeks, women, flute.

Simhamukha.usage: Lion’s face, lotus garland, worship, sacrificial fire.

Kangula.usage: Cucumber, small bell, betel nut, incense offering.

Alapadma.usage: Full-blown lotus, beauty, circular movement, showing the moon.

Chatura.usage: Gold, wetness, intelligent act, expression, oil, playful talk.

Bhramara.usage: Bee, parrot, winged insect, love, Krishna.

Hamsasya.usage: Delicate things, tying thread, painting, holding flowers, speaking.

Hamsapaksha.usage: Number six, construction of a bridge, showing sandal paste.

Samdamsha.usage: Eating, generosity, offering sacred things, rituals.

Mukula.usage: Bud, eating, lotus bud, blowing wind.

Trishula.usage: Trident, three gods, weapon of Shiva.
